alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect for Friday.

What:
Total snowfall accumulations 5 to 10 cm.
Peak snowfall rates of 2 to 4 cm per hour.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow.

When:
Late Friday morning into Friday evening.

Additional information:
An Alberta Clipper will bring snow, heavy at times, to the area. The heaviest snowfall is expected late Friday morning and afternoon, thus likely impacting the afternoon commute.

###

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.

affected_areas.area_description: Owen Sound - Blue Mountains - Northern Grey County
Saugeen Shores - Kincardine - Southern Bruce County
Mount Forest - Arthur - Northern Wellington County
Orangeville - Grand Valley - Southern Dufferin County

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect beginning this afternoon.

What:
Total snowfall accumulations near 10 cm.
Reduced visibility in snow.

When:
This afternoon into the evening.

Additional information:
An Alberta clipper will bring snow over the area this afternoon. The heaviest snowfall is expected this afternoon. The snow will taper to light flurries this evening. There is chance that low pressure system will have a more southern track resulting in some areas receiving less snow.

###

Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.

alerts.headline: weather advisory in effect
alerts.description:
Winter weather travel advisory in effect beginning this morning.

What:
Total snowfall accumulations near 10 cm.
Reduced visibility in snow.

When:
This morning through this evening.

Additional information:
An Alberta clipper will bring snow over the area today. The heaviest snowfall is expected this morning. The snow will taper to light flurries this afternoon or evening. There is chance that low pressure system will have a more southern track resulting in some areas receiving less snow.

###

Travel may be hazardous due to sudden changes in the weather.

For road conditions and other traveller information from the Ministry of Transportation, visit https://www.ontario.ca/511, https://www.twitter.com/511Ontario, or call 5-1-1.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Significant snowfall is expected to continue this morning.

What:
Total snowfall accumulations of 15 cm, with local amounts near 25 cm possible.
Peak snowfall rates of 2 to 4 cm per hour.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow.

When:
Continuing this morning through early this afternoon.

Additional information:
Snow, heavy at times, is expected to continue this morning. The highest snowfall amounts are likely over areas of higher terrain, especially near Thunder Bay. Snow is expected to taper to light flurries over Red Lake and Kenora this morning.

###

Rapidly accumulating snow will make travel difficult. Surfaces such as highways, roads, walkways and parking lots may become difficult to navigate due to accumulating snow.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.

alerts.headline: extreme cold warning in effect
alerts.description:
A period of very cold wind chills is expected.

Wind chill values near minus 45 are expected early this morning. 

Temperatures are expected to moderate with day time heating and remain just above extreme cold conditions tonight.

###

Extreme cold puts everyone at risk.

Extreme cold warnings are issued when very cold temperatures or wind chill creates an elevated risk to health such as frost bite and hypothermia.

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction:
Cover up. Frostbite can develop within minutes on exposed skin, especially with wind chill.

If it’s too cold for you to stay outside, it’s too cold for your pet to stay outside.

alerts.headline: snowfall warning in effect
alerts.description:
Significant snowfall expected today.

What:
Total snowfall accumulations near 15 cm.
Peak snowfall rates of 2 to 4 cm per hour.
Reduced visibility in heavy snow.

When:
This morning into this afternoon.

Additional information:
An Alberta Clipper will bring snow, heavy at times, to the area today. The heaviest snowfall is expected this afternoon, thus likely impacting the afternoon commute. Snow will taper off and possibly mix with rain by this evening.

###

Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@ec.gc.ca or post reports on X using #ONStorm.
alerts.instruction: Be prepared to adjust your driving with changing road conditions. If visibility is reduced while driving, turn on your lights and maintain a safe following distance.
